\begin{document}


\title{Calculation of the Periodic Exchange Matrix}


\author{C. J. Tymczak}


\date{\today{}}

\maketitle
From Crystal Manual, Chapter 3,

\[
K_{ab}=\sum _{\mathbf{hgn}}\sum _{cd}\int d{\mathbf{r}}\, d{\mathbf{r}'}\, \phi _{a}\left( {\mathbf{r}}\right) \phi _{c}\left( {\mathbf{r}+\mathbf{h}}\right) \: \left| {\mathbf{r}-\mathbf{r}'}\right| ^{-1}\: P_{cd}[{\mathbf{n}}]\, \phi _{b}\left( {\mathbf{r}''+\mathbf{g}}\right) \phi _{d}\left( {\mathbf{r}+\mathbf{h}+\mathbf{n}}\right) \]
For Our Approximation, where we have no k-space summation, 

\[
P_{cd}[{\mathbf{n}}]=P_{cd}[{0}]\, \delta _{{\mathbf{n},0}}\]
Therefore

\[
K_{ab}=\sum _{\mathbf{hg}}\sum _{cd}\int d{\mathbf{r}}\, d{\mathbf{r}'}\, \phi _{a}\left( {\mathbf{r}}\right) \phi _{c}\left( {\mathbf{r}+\mathbf{h}}\right) \: \left| {\mathbf{r}-\mathbf{r}'}\right| ^{-1}\: P_{cd}[{0}]\, \phi _{b}\left( {\mathbf{r}'+\mathbf{g}}\right) \phi _{d}\left( {\mathbf{r}'+\mathbf{h}}\right) \]


\[
K_{ab}=\sum _{\mathbf{hg}}\sum _{cd}\int d{\mathbf{r}}\, d{\mathbf{r}'}\, \phi _{a}\left( {\mathbf{r}}\right) \phi _{c}\left( {\mathbf{r}+\mathbf{h}}\right) \: \left| {\mathbf{r}-\mathbf{r}'}\right| ^{-1}\: P_{cd}[{0}]\, \phi _{b}\left( {\mathbf{r}'+\mathbf{g}}\right) \phi _{d}\left( {\mathbf{r}'+\mathbf{h}}\right) \]
which is convergent. Let us rewrite this equation, setting \( {\mathbf{r}'=\mathbf{r}'-\mathbf{h}} \)
to get\[
K_{ab}=\sum _{\mathbf{hg}}\sum _{cd}\int d{\mathbf{r}}\, d{\mathbf{r}'}\, \phi _{a}\left( {\mathbf{r}}\right) \phi _{c}\left( {\mathbf{r}+\mathbf{h}}\right) \: \left| {\mathbf{r}-\mathbf{r}'+\mathbf{h}}\right| ^{-1}\: P_{cd}[{0}]\, \phi _{b}\left( {\mathbf{r}'+\mathbf{g}}\right) \phi _{d}\left( {\mathbf{r}'}\right) \]

\end{document}
